intro: Urachne molinioides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved urachne, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and has narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small yellow flowers appear in clusters and bloom during the summer months. Urachne molinioides is generally drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soils.
